leadership.name: Dr. Maria Elena Santos
leadership.image: assets/images/Leadership Team-1-Dr. Maria Elena Santos - Executive Director.jpg
leadership.bio: A public health specialist with over 20 years of experience in humanitarian organizations. Dr. Santos previously served as Regional Director of WHO Philippines and has led relief operations across Southeast Asia.
credentials: Doctor of Public Health, University of the Philippines
Master of Public Administration, Ateneo de Manila

leadership.name: Atty. Roberto Cruz
leadership.image: assets/images/Leadership Team-2-Atty. Roberto Cruz - Director of Operations.jpg
leadership.bio: Former military officer turned humanitarian leader. Atty. Cruz brings 15 years of disaster management expertise, having coordinated relief operations for typhoons Haiyan, Mangkhut, and Odette.
credentials: Juris Doctor, San Beda College of Law
BS Military Science, Philippine Military Academy

leadership.name: Prof. Isabella Reyes
leadership.image: assets/images/Leadership Team-3-Prof. Isabella Reyes - Head of Programs.jpeg
leadership.bio: An award-winning social worker and professor specializing in community development. Prof. Reyes designed the Kabuhayan Plus framework that has been adopted by partner organizations nationwide.
credentials: PhD Community Development, De La Salle University

leadership.name: Engr. Carlos Mendoza
leadership.image: assets/images/Leadership Team-4-Engr. Carlos Mendoza - Volunteer Coordinator.jpg
leadership.bio: A civil engineer who manages the network of 12,847 volunteers nationwide. Engr. Mendoza developed the BRC volunteer management system and training curriculum used across all chapters.

timeline.title: Foundation
timeline.description: Bayanihan Relief Corps was established by a group of Filipino volunteers in Manila, inspired by the bayanihan spirit of community solidarity.

timeline.title: Typhoon Ondoy Response
timeline.description: Mobilized first major disaster response operation, deploying 200 volunteers and reaching 5,000 affected families in Metro Manila and Rizal.

timeline.title: Typhoon Haiyan Operations
timeline.description: Largest relief operation to date. Deployed 1,500+ volunteers across Eastern Visayas, distributed 250,000 relief packs, and established 25 emergency shelters.

timeline.title: National Expansion
timeline.description: Established regional offices in Cebu and Davao. Launched the Mobile Health Caravan and Youth Brigade programs to expand services beyond disaster response.

timeline.title: Pandemic Response
timeline.description: Pivoted operations to support COVID-19 frontliners and vulnerable communities. Distributed 500,000 PPE kits and supported community food pantries nationwide.

timeline.title: Digital Transformation
timeline.description: Launched online volunteer management system, virtual training programs, and the Blood Heroes mobile app for emergency blood requests.

timeline.title: 20th Anniversary & Beyond
timeline.description: Celebrating 20 years of humanitarian service with 12,847 active volunteers, operations in 81 provinces, and a renewed commitment to community resilience.

missionVisionValues.mission: To protect lives and livelihoods of the most vulnerable Filipino communities through timely humanitarian assistance, disaster preparedness, and sustainable development programs.
missionVisionValues.vision: A resilient Philippines where every community has the capacity to prepare for, respond to, and recover from disasters and crises — united by the spirit of Bayanihan.

values.name: Malasakit (Compassion)
values.description: We act with genuine concern and empathy for those we serve, treating every individual with dignity and respect.

values.name: Pagkakaisa (Unity)
values.description: We believe in the power of community — working together across cultures, sectors, and boundaries to achieve common goals.

values.name: Katapatan (Integrity)
values.description: We uphold transparency, accountability, and ethical standards in every aspect of our operations and stewardship.

values.name: Katatagan (Resilience)
values.description: We empower communities to build their own capacity for preparedness and recovery, fostering long-term self-reliance.
